bill_title: to revise the requirements by which parole hearings may be held by teleconference.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the requirements by which parole hearings may be held by teleconference. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-13-11 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-11. The Board of Pardons and Paroles may conduct hearings by teleconference provided that at least one member of the board is physically present with the prisoner . The board may transmit documentary evidence via facsimile machines or other electronic means of document transfer. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the requirements by which parole hearings may be held by teleconference. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-13-11 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-11. The Board of Pardons and Paroles may conduct hearings by teleconference provided that at least one member of the board is physically present with the prisoner unless the hearing concerns the revocation of the prisoner's parole . The board may transmit documentary evidence via facsimile machines or other electronic means of document transfer. BILL HISTORY January 14 - First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 30 January 17 - Passed as amended, PASSED, AYES 12, NAYS 1. H.J. 76

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the requirements by which parole hearings may be held by teleconference. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-13-11 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-11. The Board of Pardons and Paroles may conduct hearings by teleconference provided that at least one member of the board is physically present with the prisoner during a regularly scheduled hearing unless the hearing concerns the revocation of the prisoner's parole or is the prisoner's initial parole hearing pursuant to § 24-15A-39 . The board may transmit documentary evidence via facsimile machines or other electronic means of document transfer. BILL HISTORY 1/14/97 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 30 1/17/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, AYES 12, NAYS 1. 1/24/97 Deferred to another day. H.J. 118 1/27/97 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, AYES 52, NAYS 18. H.J. 158 1/28/97 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 200 2/5/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/5/97 Judiciary Do Pass, AYES 5, NAYS 2. S.J. 339 2/10/97 Motion to Amend. 2/10/97 Senate Do Pass Amended, AYES 29, NAYS 6.
